# simdWorldTransform

**Instance Property**

The world transform applied to the node.

## Declaration

```swift
var simdWorldTransform: simd_float4x4 { get set }
```

## Discussion

A world transform is the node’s coordinate space transform relative to the scene’s coordinate space. This transform is the concatenation of the node’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/simdTransform] property with that of its parent node, the parent’s parent, and so on up to the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/rootNode] object of the scene.

## Related Documentation

- **worldTransform**: The world transform applied to the node.
- **parent**: The node’s parent in the scene graph hierarchy.

## Managing Transforms in World Space

- **simdWorldOrientation**: The node’s orientation relative to the scene’s world coordinate space.
- **simdWorldPosition**: The node’s position relative to the scene’s world coordinate space.
